title.narrative: 3.2 GOOD HYGIENE & SANITATION PRACTICES

description.narrative: Output 3.2: By 2018, households, including children and adolescents, adopt favourable behaviours for improving hygiene and sanitation conditions at community level, in schools and health facilities, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2018, children, in particular the most vulnerable, have access to improved water sources and adequate sanitation facilities in schools, health centers and communities to prevent diseases, including in emergency situations.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE LA POSTE ET DES NOUVEL TECHNOLOGIES DE L INFORMATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.2: By 2018, households, including children and adolescents, adopt favourable behaviours for improving hygiene andsanitation conditions at community level, in schools and health facilities

description.narrative: In 2018, the Government finalized and validated the CLTS implementation guide, disseminated the Niger ODF by 2030 roadmap with UNICEF support and strengthened capacities of implementing partners to scale up CLTS. Bagaroua (129 communities with 89,735 inhabitants), was celebrated first ODF municipality in Niger demonstrating the change of implementation scale. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of villages initiating CLTS during the reporting year as a result of the UNICEF programme (2014-2018) in convergence municipalities
Number of schools having undertaken school community activities related to hygiene promotion as a result of the UNICEF programme (2014-2018) in convergence municipalities
Number of villages certified ODF during the reporting year as a result of the UNICEF programme (2014-2018) in convergence municipalities
Number of additional persons living in ODF villages as a result of the UNICEF programme (2014-2018) in convergence municipalities
of people in communities that have been certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only
Number of schools supported by UNICEF during the year of reporting with separate sanitation facilities for boys and girls
Number of additional people living in the newly certified Open Defecation Free (ODF) communities as a result of UNICEF CATS programming during the year of reporting
A national CLTS implementation guide is developed and adopted by the government and partners
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Community-based hand-washing behaviour change Communication programme implemented on a national scale
